title: Mexican Peso Tumbles Following President Nieto’s Cancellation Of Meeting With Trump
text:
New Poll Shows Most Americans Support Trump’s Speech 
“I would say in months. Yeah, I would say in months. Certainly planning is starting immediately,” Trump replied. 
In response to the executive order, Nieto stated , “I’ve said time and again: Mexico won’t pay for any wall.” 
The Mexican president’s comments prompted Trump to tweet on Thursday morning: The U.S. has a 60 billion dollar trade deficit with Mexico. It has been a one-sided deal from the beginning of NAFTA with massive numbers… 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 26, 2017 of jobs and companies lost. If Mexico is unwilling to pay for the badly needed wall, then it would be better to cancel the upcoming meeting. 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 26, 2017 
Nieto apparently took the cue and decided to cancel the meeting. 
Trump told Republican lawmakers gathered in Philadelphia for a retreat on Thursday that the decision was mutual. Donald Trump says meeting Mexican president would be "fruitless" if they don't agree to pay for border wall https://t.co/4TXyviCNmM pic.twitter.com/m3OqGX6j0O 
— BBC Breaking News (@BBCBreaking) January 26, 2017 
“Unless Mexico is going to treat the United States fairly, with respect, such a meeting would be fruitless,” the president said. 
The peso hit a record low of 22.0385 on Jan. 11, and traders still believe that Trump’s efforts to renegotiate the North American Free Trade Agreement will have negative results on the Mexican economy. What do you think? Scroll down to comment below. Advertisement Popular Right Now
